Body: I am planning a IoT" project and my big problem so far is to install a RaspberryPi on a LAN
column12:
or NGROK. The idea is to create a product that works "Out of the box".

The RaspberryPi have a web service running
column14:
and also will be sending HTTPRequest to populate a database with information.

Thanks for the help.

(Sorry for my english...)

"

Body: You should look into UPnP. I think there is a way for your device to tell your home router that it provides some service, and the home router will set up port forwarding automatically if it supports UPnP.
Thank you David, you answer is just **perfect**.
Do you think that using a VPN is a more professional way of doing this? I'm just seeing options.
I don't really see a reason to use a VPN except perhaps that it takes care of the authentication for you so you don't need to do that on your device.  But overall it's less convenient.
I thought that maybe adding all the RPi to my private VPN I can directly access them through IP Address. Sorry if it is a terrible idea, but I thought that LOL.
